Sentence.sentence: However, it's clear that Macy's believes its troubles run deeper than a temporary aberration ( ' , 偏离) off the thermometer.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: In a study published in Nature Scientific Reports, we reveal just how deep this  injustice runs.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: The researchers decided to go deeper, however.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: The apparent struggles of the floundering (挣扎的）group have what Kapur calls a "hidden efficacy": they lead people to understand the deep structure of problems, not simply their correct solutions.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: In the real world, problems rarely come neatly packaged, so being able to discern their deep structure is key
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: But numerous studies have now found that when classroom material is made harder to absorb, pupils retain more of it over the long term, and understand it on a deeper level.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: But Washington would do well to take a deep breath before reacting to the grim numbers.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: A shattering loss of confidence inspires behavior that overwhelms the normal self-correcting mechanisms that usually prevent a recession from becoming deep and prolonged: a depression
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: More than that, empathy（同感,共鸣）,as well as deep thought.
Sentence.come: 出自-2012年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: It is actually something deeper than mere happiness: it is joy, which the monk（僧侣）David Steindl-Rast describes as "that kind of happiness that doesn't depend on what happens.
Sentence.come: 出自-2012年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Some propose storing the CO2 in coal mines or liquid storage in the ocean, Shell favors storing CO2 in deep geological structures such as saline(盐的) formations and exhausted oil and gas fields that exist throughout the world.
Sentence.come: 出自-2012年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: What parents do, in other words, is of deep concern to the state, for the obvious reason that caring for children is not only morally urgent but essential for the future of society.
Sentence.come: 出自-2010年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: In our times, human shrewdness has mastered the deep mysteries of the earth at a level far beyond the capacities of earlier peoples.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: He spent most of his days outdoors and had deep love for the wild lands.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: The proof, which was published last week in Science, comes from a team of scientists from Uppsala University in Sweden and California Institute of Technology who drew deep holes near the edge of ice sheet.
Sentence.come: 出自-2010年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: But what happens when new players emerge, who don't have deep roots within the existing culture?
Sentence.come: 2019年6月六级真题（第三套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: Hale wasn't just a writer, she was also a fierce social advocate, and she was particularly obsessed with an ideal New England, which she associated with abundant Thanksgiving meals that she claimed had a deep moral influence.
Sentence.come: 2018年6月六级真题（第一套）阅读 Section A

Sentence.sentence: In a study published in Nature Scientific Reports, we reveal just how deep this injustice runs.
Sentence.come: 2016年12月六级真题（第二套）阅读 Section C

Sentence.sentence: It was specifically observed that the left side of the brain was more active during deep sleep.
Sentence.come: 2017年6月六级真题（第三套）阅读 Section A

Sentence.sentence: Our deep look into those data and their preparation revealed serious problems.
Sentence.come: 2019年6月六级真题（第一套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: Some plants store reserves of water to see them through a drought; others send roots deep down to subsurface water supplies.
Sentence.come: 2018年6月六级真题（第一套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: When the researchers repeated the laboratory experiment on the second and third nights they found the left hemisphere could not be stimulated in the same way during deep sleep.
Sentence.come: 2017年6月六级真题（第三套）阅读 Section A

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这两个形容词都有表示"深的"之意。
means: deep ： 普通用词，指由上到下，或由表及里的深度，可指具体或抽象事物。
profound ： 语气较强，较为庄重，多指抽象的事物，多用于比喻。

list.explanation: 采取断然或激烈的行动

example.en: He jumped off the deep end and got married again.
example.zh: 他断然地采取了行动，并且再次结了婚。

word_mean: 守场员移后防守的地方
深的：远在表面之下方的，非表面的

Sentence.sentence: Champions are made from something they have deep inside them.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语江苏卷 阅读理解 阅读D 原文

Sentence.sentence: Dismissing small talk as unimportant is easy, but we can't forget that deep relationships wouldn't.
Sentence.come: 2018年高考英语全国卷2 阅读理解 阅读D 原文

Sentence.sentence: For weeks, I've been thinking of bigger, deeper questions: how do we make it a habit for them?
Sentence.come: 2018年高考英语全国卷3 阅读理解 阅读D 原文

Sentence.sentence: He unfortunately passed away last year due to his cancer, but he left a deep impression on me and gave me the inspiration to pick up my pen again.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语江苏卷 完形填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: I would scream, "I hate you!" Dad would yell back, "Good! I don't care!" Deep down I knew he did.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语天津卷 阅读表达 原文

Sentence.sentence: If you studied pictures that ancient people left on rock walls and you tried to determine their meaning, you would not detect a deep interest in romance among the artists.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语上海卷 完形填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: Later, engineers managed to construct railways in a system of deep tunnels, which became known to the tube.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语全国卷2 语法填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: Move more slowly in deep water.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语北京卷 阅读理解 阅读C 选项

Sentence.sentence: Nicholas left Grylls a very deep impression because he did the right things in the dangerous situation.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语北京卷 阅读理解 阅读A 题设

Sentence.sentence: On the other hand, whenever I had plunged into deep water, forced by courage or circumstance, I had always been able to swim until I got my feet on the ground again.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语天津卷 阅读理解 阅读D 原文

Sentence.sentence: Place your cup in the deepest part of the hole.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语全国卷1 阅读理解 阅读D 原文

Sentence.sentence: Several safari camps operate as the base for this adventure, providing unique rides twice a day to explore deep into the delta.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语重庆卷 阅读理解 阅读D 原文

Sentence.sentence: That is why fish prefer shallow water to deep water because the former is warmer.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语广东卷 阅读理解 阅读B 原文

Sentence.sentence: That relief is coupled with a deep understanding of why the same people keep coming back for more: connecting to the community as you freely give your time, money, skills, or services provides a real joy.
Sentence.come: 2019年高考英语全国卷2 阅读理解 阅读B 原文

Sentence.sentence: They went farther north into the deep forests of Canada, where there were fewer humans around.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语全国卷3 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

Sentence.sentence: They were almost knee-deep when they realized it was a hot spring.
Sentence.come: 2018年高考英语天津卷 阅读理解 阅读D 原文

Sentence.sentence: This suggests that British attitudes towards accent have deep roots and are based on class prejudice.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语广东卷 阅读理解 阅读D 原文

Sentence.sentence: To construct a working still, use a sharp stick or rock to dig a hole four feet across and three feet deep.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语全国卷1 阅读理解 阅读D 原文

Sentence.sentence: Wang's works show a deep understanding of modern architecture and a good knowledge of traditions.
Sentence.come: 2018年高考英语全国卷3 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

Sentence.sentence: When these organisms die, they bury carbon in the deep ocean, an important process that helps to regulate the global climate.
Sentence.come: 2019年高考英语北京卷 阅读理解 阅读D 原文

Sentence.sentence: While, deep down, we know we can do it, our mind—or the minds of those close to us—usually says we can't.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语福建卷 阅读理解 阅读D 原文

Sentence.sentence: Works of this type, he believed, spoke to deep and unvarying features of human nature and could continue to exist over centuries.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语重庆卷 阅读理解 阅读E 原文

Sentence.sentence: So what does our deep future hold? A growing number of researchers and organisations are now thinking seriously about that question.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Now utopia has grown unfashionable, as we have gained a deeper appreciation of the range of threats facing us, from asteroid strike to epidemic flu and to climate change.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: In the 2006 film version of The Devil Wears Prada ,Miranda Priestly, played by Meryl Streep, scolds her unattractive assistant for imagining that high fashion doesn’t affect her, Priestly explains how the deep blue color of the assistant’s sweater descended over the years from fashion shows to departments stores and to the bargain bin in which the poor girl doubtless found her garment.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Olduvai Gorge, an early hominid site in Tanzania, was found by a butterfly hunter who literally fell into its deep valley in 1911.
Sentence.come: 出自-2014年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: The humiliations of his father’s imprisonment and his labor in the blacking factory formed Dicken’s greatest wound and became his deepest secret.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: At any given point, I should have deep work scheduled for roughly the next month.
Sentence.come: 2018年考研真题（英语二）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: But another, related force—a policy often buried deep in course catalogs called "grade forgiveness"—is helping raise GPAs.
Sentence.come: 2019年考研真题（英语一）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: Deep reading requires not just time, but a special kind of time which can't be obtained merely by becoming more efficient.
Sentence.come: 2016年考研真题（英语二）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: Further arrangements—and there may be many—between the NHS and Deep mind will be carefully scrutinized to ensure that all necessary permissions have been asked of patients and all unnecessary data has been cleaned.
Sentence.come: 2018年考研真题（英语一）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: It is not enough to say that the algorithms Deep mind develops will benefit patients and save lives.
Sentence.come: 2018年考研真题（英语一）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: Priestly explains how the deep blue color of the assistant's sweater descended over the years from fashion shows to department stores and to the bargain bin in which the poor girl doubtless found her garment.
Sentence.come: 2013年考研真题（英语一）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: So what does our deep future hold?
Sentence.come: 2013年考研真题（英语一）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: There are a number of approaches to mastering the art of deep work—be it lengthy retreats dedicated to a specific task; developing a daily ritual; or taking a "journalistic" approach to seizing moments of deep work when you can throughout the day.
Sentence.come: 2018年考研真题（英语二）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: To combat the trap of putting a premium on being busy, Cal Newport, author of Deep work: Rules for Focused Success in a distracted World, recommends building a habit of "deep work"—the ability to focus without distraction.
Sentence.come: 2018年考研真题（英语二）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

sentences.en: The river is not deep;  we can walk through it.
sentences.cn: 这河不深, 我们可以涉水过去。

means.word_mean: 位于深处的, 纵深的

sentences.en: The sea was deep blue.
sentences.cn: 大海是深蓝色的。

sentences.en: Don't you love his deep, rich voice?
sentences.cn: 你难道不喜欢他低沉、浑厚的嗓音吗?

means.word_mean: 强烈的, 极度的, 深厚的

sentences.en: The company is in deep trouble again.
sentences.cn: 这家公司再度陷入严重的困境。

sentences.en: He is deep in translation.
sentences.cn: 他在翻译方面有很深的造诣。

sentences.en: Philosophy is too deep for me.
sentences.cn: 哲学对我来说太深奥了。

means.word_mean: 靠近对方端线的；靠近外场线的

sentences.en: Still waters run deep.
sentences.cn: 静水流深。

sentences.en: He walked deep into the woods.
sentences.cn: 他走到树林的深处。

sentences.en: We talked deep into the night.
sentences.cn: 我们谈至深夜。</seg>

data.mean: deep down 本质上；实际上；事实上

sentence.cn: 这就是为什么鱼更喜欢浅水而不是深水，因为前者温度较高。
sentence.en: That is why fish prefer shallow water to deep water because the former is warmer.
sentence.from: 2015年高考英语广东卷 阅读理解 阅读B 原文

sentence.cn: 不幸的是，他去年因癌症去世了，但他给我留下了深深的印象，也给了我重新拾笔的灵感。
sentence.en: He unfortunately passed away last year due to his cancer,  but he left a deep impression on me and gave me the inspiration to pick up my pen again.
sentence.from: 2015年高考英语江苏卷 完形填空 原文

jx.jx_en_mean: the end of a swimming pool where the water is deepest

phrase.cizu_name: go off (或 go in off) the deep end

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)give way immediately to an emotional outburst, especially of anger

lj.lj_ly: he landed in deep water when he began the affair.
lj.lj_ls: 他开始婚外恋的时候就惹上麻烦了。

phrase.cizu_name: jump (或 be thrown) in at the deep end

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)face a difficult problem or undertaking with little experience of it

lj.lj_ly: Deep down, she was still a rebel.
lj.lj_ls: 她实质上仍是个叛逆者

entry.def: If something is deep, it extends a long way down from the ground or from the top surface of something.

example.ex: The water is very deep and mysterious-looking...
example.tran: 水看上去幽深叵测。

example.ex: Den had dug a deep hole in the centre of the garden...
example.tran: 德恩在花园的中央挖了一个深洞。

entry.def: A deep container, such as a cupboard, extends or measures a long distance from front to back.

example.ex: The wardrobe was very deep.
example.tran: 这个衣柜很深。

entry.def: You use deep to talk or ask about how much something measures from the surface to the bottom, or from front to back.

example.ex: I found myself in water only three feet deep...
example.tran: 我发现脚下的水只有 3 英尺深。

example.ex: The mud is ankle deep around Shush Square...
example.tran: 舒什广场周围的泥水深及脚踝。

entry.def: Deep in an area means a long way inside it

example.ex: They were now deep inside rebel territory.
example.tran: 他们现在已深入叛军占领区。

example.ex: ...deep inside the country...
example.tran: 深入该国的腹地

entry.def: In sports such as football and tennis, a deep shot or pass is one that sends the ball a long way towards the end of the pitch or court.
entry.tran: (足球、网球等运动中球)纵深的，靠近对方端线的

example.ex: ...Steve Staunton's deep cross.
example.tran: 史蒂夫·斯汤顿的纵深横传

example.ex: ...a deep volley.
example.tran: 凌空远射

entry.def: If you say that things or people are two ,three, or four deep, you mean that there are two, three, or four rows or layers of them there.

example.ex: A crowd three deep seemed paralysed by the images on these monitors...
example.tran: 里里外外三层的人群看到显示屏上的画面似乎全都惊呆了。

example.ex: The rest of the space was taken up by cardboard boxes piled right to the ceiling, ten deep.
example.tran: 其余的空间都被纸板盒子占据了，一直摞到天花板，足有 10 层高。

entry.def: You use deep to emphasize the seriousness, strength, importance, or degree of something.
entry.tran: 严重的;深切的;深厚的;深深的

example.ex: I had a deep admiration for Sartre...
example.tran: 我对萨特怀有深深的敬意。

example.ex: ...a period of deep personal crisis...
example.tran: 经历严重个人危机的一段时期

entry.def: If you experience or feel something deep inside you or deep down, you feel it very strongly even though you do not necessarily show it.

example.ex: I kept reassuring them but deep in my heart I knew we had no hope...
example.tran: 我一再安慰他们，但在内心深处我知道我们没有任何希望。

example.ex: Deep down, she supported her husband's involvement in the organization.
example.tran: 在心底里，她支持丈夫参加这个组织。

entry.def: If you are in a deep sleep, you are sleeping peacefully and it is difficult to wake you.

example.ex: Una soon fell into a deep sleep.
example.tran: 尤娜很快便沉沉睡去。

entry.def: If you are deep in thought or deep in conversation, you are concentrating very hard on what you are thinking or saying and are not aware of the things that are happening around you.
entry.tran: 沉浸在…中的;专注于…的;埋头于…的

example.ex: Abby had been so deep in thought that she had walked past her aunt's car without even seeing it...
example.tran: 阿比沉浸在自己的思绪中，以至于从她姨妈的车边经过时都没有注意到。

example.ex: Before long, we were deep in conversation.
example.tran: 没过多久，我们便聊得很起劲了。

entry.def: A deep look seems to see right into your mind.

example.ex: Peter gave him a long deep look.
example.tran: 彼得深邃的目光长久地注视着他。

entry.def: A deep breath or sigh uses or fills the whole of your lungs.

example.ex: Cal took a long, deep breath, struggling to control his own emotions...
example.tran: 卡尔深长地吸了一口气，努力控制自己的情绪。

example.ex: At last he gave a deep sigh.
example.tran: 最后他一声长叹。

entry.def: You use deep to describe colours that are strong and fairly dark.

example.ex: The sky was deep blue and starry...
example.tran: 天空一片深蓝色，其间星光闪烁。

example.ex: The tree has gnarled red branches and deep green leaves.
example.tran: 这棵树的树枝扭曲多瘤且呈红色，树叶则是深绿色。

entry.def: A deep sound is low in pitch.

example.ex: His voice was deep and mellow...
example.tran: 他的声音深沉而柔和。

example.ex: They heard a deep, distant roar.
example.tran: 他们听到远处传来一声低沉的怒吼。

entry.def: If you describe someone as deep, you mean that they are quiet and reserved in a way that makes you think that they have good qualities such as intelligence or determination.

example.ex: James is a very deep individual...
example.tran: 詹姆斯是一个非常内敛的人。

example.ex: That expressionless face had seemed deep and mysterious.
example.tran: 那张毫无表情的脸看上去深沉而又神秘。

entry.def: If you describe something such as a problem or a piece of writing as deep, you mean that it is important, serious, or complicated.
entry.tran: (问题、文章等)重要的，严肃的，深刻的

example.ex: This is a very deep question...
example.tran: 这是一个非常严肃的问题。

example.ex: They're written as adventure stories. They're not intended to be deep.
example.tran: 它们是作为历险故事来写的，并没打算追求深刻。

entry.def: If you are deep in debt, you have a lot of debts.

example.ex: He is so deep in debt and desperate for money that he's apparently willing to say anything...
example.tran: 他负债累累，急需要钱，很显然什么话都说得出来。

example.ex: The company is sliding even deeper into the red.
example.tran: 公司的亏损状况进一步恶化。

entry.def: The deep means the sea.

example.ex: ...a vast unfrequented pool, traversed by whales and creatures of the deep.
example.tran: 一个面积巨大、人迹罕至的水池，鲸和其他海洋动物穿游其间

entry.def: If you know something deep down or deep down inside, you know that it is true, but you are not always conscious of it or willing to admit it to yourself.
entry.tran: 在内心深处，在心底（知道）

example.ex: We knew deep down that we could do it...
example.tran: 在内心深处，我们知道自己能够做到。

example.ex: Deep down, we had always detested each other.
example.tran: 我们在心底里一直都讨厌彼此。

entry.def: If you say that you took a deep breath before doing something dangerous or frightening, you mean that you tried to make yourself feel strong and confident.
entry.tran: 深吸一口气(以使自己坚强自信)

example.ex: I took a deep breath and went in.
example.tran: 我深吸一口气，然后走了进去。

entry.def: If you say that something goes deep or runs deep, you mean that it is very serious or strong and is hard to change.
entry.tran: 非常严重;极为强烈;根深蒂固

example.ex: His anger and anguish clearly went deep...
example.tran: 他的愤怒和痛苦显然是深切而强烈的。

example.ex: The problems went deeper than mere teething difficulties.
example.tran: 问题不仅仅是起始阶段的小麻烦那么简单。

means.word_mean: 1. the central and most intense or profound part;
2. a long steep-sided depression in the ocean floor
1. relatively deep or strong; affecting one deeply;
3. having great spatial extension or penetration downward or inward from an outer surface or backward or laterally or outward from a center; sometimes used in combination;

sentences.sentence: "hit the ball to deep center field"

means.word_mean: 4. very distant in time or space;
6. having or denoting a low vocal or instrumental range;

sentences.sentence: "a bass voice is lower than a baritone voice"

means.word_mean: 8. relatively thick from top to bottom;
12. with head or back bent low;

sentences.sentence: "the new insurance policy is written without cryptic or mysterious terms"
"in its mysterious past it encompasses all the dim origins of life"- Rachel Carson
"rituals totally mystifying to visitors from other lands"

means.word_mean: 14. difficult to penetrate; incomprehensible to one of ordinary understanding or knowledge;

sentences.sentence: "the professor's lectures were so abstruse that students tended to avoid them"

means.word_mean: 15. exhibiting great cunning usually with secrecy;

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English dēop (adjective), dīope, dēope (adverb), of Germanic origin; related to Dutch diep and German tief, also to dip
